abstracts.cdata!:
The project is intended to assist the
            Government in carrying out an emergency rehabilitation
            program to alleviate the severe disruption in the
            transportation sector, especially the cyclone damaged road
            infrastructure. The project would cover about one half of
            the damage suffered by the road sector, would be executed by
            the Public Works Department (PWD) and would include : a)
            extraordinary maintenance works to protect stretches of the
            main circumferential roads from further erosion by wave
            action and to keep the roads passable by vehicles; b)
            rehabilitation of priority links of the Upola and
            Savai'i circumferential roads; c) technical assistance
            and consulting services for designs and construction
            supervision and project management; d) procurement of
            navigation lights and beacons to restore cyclone damaged
            navigation facilities; e ) procurement of road maintenance
            equipment; f) short term overseas training for PWD staff;
            and g) an institutional strengthening study. The objective
            of the project is to alleviate the severe disruptio
            transportation sector caused by cyclone damage.  It will
            also help res economic activities in Upolu and Savai'i
            by the full rehabilitation of sections of circumferential
            roads as well as coastal protection works. project will also
            assist the government to carry out independent audit project
            accounts of ongoing IDA-financed projects.  The project
            remain essentially the same with some adjustment because of
            Cyclone Val.  The being rehabilitated under Credit 2131-WSO
            will be completed with reconstruction or repair of new
            cyclone damage and additional coastal protection works as
            required.  Reconstruction of the Upolu East Coast will
            involve some minor realignments where the road goes around a
            clif shoreline will remain unprotected because of the depth
            of water at the base.  Extensions of 15 months for the
            supervising consultant's contra been included.  In
            addition, maintenance equipment requirements, agree Cyclone
            Ofa, have been reviewed and revised.  A small component has
            be to assist the Government of Western Samoa to carry out
